title: Aliasing &mut hiding behind trait objects

milestone.description:
This will be the first major release of Rust, where we offer some guaranteed level of support and backwards compatibility.

The significant criteria for this release are:

* Language backwards compatibility - All major features are in, and in their final form. Generally, the only new language features added after this milestone must be backwards compatible, or to fix soundness holes, though we do expect to have some leeway to make small incompatible fixes that have low impact on existing code bases.

* Library stability - We have a system of measuring and ensuring the stability of API's, and a significant portion of the standard library is declared stable. Stable API's will not change. Large portions of the standard library need to be stable for 1.0, including primitive types, vectors, strings, option, numerics, collections, some I/O and concurrency.

* User experience - The system is polished and the presentation is complete and professional. New users have a clear path to using and learning the system. This encompasses the web site, documentation, installation, and tooling.

body:
Looking at some cargo code today, I think that we have a soundness hole where we have multiple instances of a `&mut` pointer hiding behind trait objects:
- We have ids which are [loaded into `Box<Source + 'a>`](https://github.com/rust-lang/cargo/blob/c18281110e92070931796825021cacfd9f9b10eb/src/cargo/core/source.rs#L199-L213) objects, and each `Source` [holds a pointer](https://github.com/rust-lang/cargo/blob/c18281110e92070931796825021cacfd9f9b10eb/src/cargo/sources/registry.rs#L27) to the `&'a mut Config` instance
- Elsewhere, we have a [`HashMap<SourceId, Box<Source + 'a>>`](https://github.com/rust-lang/cargo/blob/c18281110e92070931796825021cacfd9f9b10eb/src/cargo/core/source.rs#L325-L327) which is stored in [one structure](https://github.com/rust-lang/cargo/blob/c18281110e92070931796825021cacfd9f9b10eb/src/cargo/core/registry.rs#L25).
- In the structure storing the `SourceMap`, we [call the `load` method](https://github.com/rust-lang/cargo/blob/c18281110e92070931796825021cacfd9f9b10eb/src/cargo/core/registry.rs#L89) which is where we pass in the `&mut Config` (note that the config pointer is also [stored in the structure](https://github.com/rust-lang/cargo/blob/c18281110e92070931796825021cacfd9f9b10eb/src/cargo/core/registry.rs#L27)).

What ends up happening is that each `Box<Source + 'a>` has a handle to the same `&'a mut Config` as well as the `PackageRegistry` having a handle on `&'a mut Config`. I don't think that's a sound thing to do!

I vaguely remember trying to reduce this awhile ago and was unable to, but I wanted to make sure that this was listed here!

Nominating as I think this may be a hole that needs plugging.
